page.title: 09APPLES AT CHARLTON ORCHARDS
page.content: The main varieties of apples grown at Charlton Orchards are Cox's Orange Pippin,Spartan,Discovery,Fortune, Merton,Worcester,Lord Lambourne and Bramley. To help the tree keep its crop and to make picking easier,the farmer ties down the vertical branches so that they grow more horizontally.They are tied down in April,for a couple of months.To assess if the apple trees need spraying the farmer uses a series of small,white boxes called trucks.If more than five moths are in a truck the trees will be sprayed.If necessary they will be sprayed every 12_14 days between April and August. The different varieties of apple ripen at different times,from August through to March.They are picked by hand.A skilled picker can pick 700lbs in a day.
